meanings.sent1: The dark clouds had a suppressive effect on the cheerful mood of the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The suppressive medication helped control the patient's symptoms.
meanings.sent3: The suppressive rain ruined our plans for a day at the beach.
meanings.sent4: Her suppressive attitude towards new ideas stifled creativity in the team.
meanings.sent5: The suppressive silence in the room made everyone feel uneasy.

meanings.sent1: The suppressive laws limited freedom of speech in the country.
meanings.sent2: The suppressive measures were put in place to maintain order during the protest.
meanings.sent3: The suppressive rules made it challenging for the students to express themselves.
meanings.sent4: Her suppressive actions towards her employees led to a decrease in morale.
meanings.sent5: The suppressive atmosphere in the room made it hard to breathe.

meanings.sent1: The suppressive treatment effectively controlled the spread of the virus.
meanings.sent2: The suppressive nature of the drug helped alleviate the symptoms.
meanings.sent3: The suppressive technology prevented unauthorized access to the system.
meanings.sent4: His suppressive remarks silenced the room during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The suppressive force of the magnet held the metal in place.
